info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 11:04PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut and western Massachusetts, including the following counties, in northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield. In western Massachusetts, Berkshire. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1103 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Torrington, New Milford, Great Barrington, Thomaston, New Hartford, Lee, Sheffield, Kent, Sharon, Norfolk, Otis, Litchfield, Canaan, Sandisfield, Falls Village, Cornwall Bridge, Ashley Falls, Winsted, Northwest Harwinton and New Preston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
